command

Class Command

  • java.lang.Object
    • command.Command
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CmdAdd, CmdClear, CmdDelete, CmdExit, CmdHelp, CmdList, CmdSearch, CmdUndo, CmdUpdate

    public abstract class Command
extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public abstract java.lang.String execute()
        Executes the command
        Returns:
        The string to output for user display

      • undo

        public abstract java.lang.String undo()
        Undo an operation. Applies to manipulative commands only
        Returns:
        The string to output for user display

      • isUndoable

        public abstract boolean isUndoable()
        Determines if the command supports the undo function
        Returns:
        True if command supports undo function, false if it does not

      • getRequiredFields

        public abstract java.lang.String[] getRequiredFields()
        Get the list of fields that are required to run this command
        Returns:
        List of required parameter names

      • getOptionalFields

        public abstract java.lang.String[] getOptionalFields()
        Get the list of optional fields that can be used to run this command
        Returns:
        List of required parameter names

      • setParameter

        public void setParameter(java.lang.String parameterName,
                         java.lang.String parameterValue)
        Sets the parameters required for some commands. Should be called before calling execute()
        Parameters:
        parameterName - The name of parameter to set
        parameterValue - The value of parameter to set

      • setTask

        public void setTask(Task t)
        Sets the task to be worked on. Should be called before calling executed()
        Parameters:
        t - The task to set

      • getTask

        public Task getTask()
        Returns the task to be worked on
        Returns:
        The task if it's found, null if it isn't

      • addHistory

        public static void addHistory(Command toAdd)
        Add a command to the list of history. To be called after successfully executing a manipulation command
        Parameters:
        toAdd - The command to add to the list of history
